thread.title: South Sudan army readies camps for pullout from capital
thread.title_full: South Sudan army readies camps for pullout from capital | News24

author: news24.com
title: South Sudan army readies camps for pullout from capital
text:
Juba - South Sudan's army said on Friday it was preparing bases outside the capital ahead of a pullout from Juba as part of a peace deal to end a 21-month civil war.
"The bases are being prepared outside Juba, as per the peace agreement, ahead of the army moving there in the days ahead," army information chief, Brigadier General Malak Ayuen, said on Friday, although adding the sites currently have "no water and no shelter".
At least eight sites, in all directions from the capital, had been scouted ahead of a redeployment of troops to within a 25km radius of the city.
The army and rebels have repeatedly traded blame, accusing each other of breaking an internationally-brokered August 29 ceasefire deal, the eighth such agreement to have been signed since civil war broke out in December 2013.
